revised_title: Anatomy of Nerves in Frog's Lung
tldr: The author re-examined the frog's lung to study its nervous apparatus, specifically the pulmonary branches of the vagus nerve. They found that the nerves contained both medullated and non-medullated fibers, which connected to the alveolar wall and formed a plexus of nerve fibrils. The study also discovered that nerve cells were abundant in the lung, with both straight and spiral processes. This research provided a detailed understanding of the frog's lung's nerve structure and function.
